txt.en: Radagast knows the ancient evil of the Gaunt-lord Ivar, called the Blood-hand, who is raising an army of wights in Agamaur.

'You have made quite the name for yourself, [placeholder]. Word of your exploits has reached me even here. Indeed, I am surprised with all you have accomplished. Still, perhaps you can assist me again.

'I know what began the plague in Agamaur, the Red Swamp. A Gaunt-lord, a dire creature in the service of Angmar, has raised an army of wights here and has stirred this ancient evil, not the Eglain. I must ask you to intervene on my behalf, for I cannot. Would you go in my stead?

'In the east are the ruins called Garth Agarwen. I would search there for Ivar the Blood-hand. If you find him and defeat him, bring his helm to me as proof.'

Ivar may be found in Garth Agarwen in Agamaur, within the Lone-lands.\n\nRadagast is unable to directly interfere in the war by seeking out and destroying Ivar the Bloodhand. He has asked you to go in his stead and to bring him Ivar's helm as proof of your victory.

'You have made quite the name for yourself, [placeholder]. Word of your exploits has reached me even here. Indeed, I am surprised with all you have accomplished. Still, perhaps you can assist me again.

'I know what began the plague in Agamaur, the Red Swamp. A Gaunt-lord, a dire creature in the service of Angmar, has raised an army of wights here and has stirred this ancient evil, not the Eglain. I must ask you to intervene on my behalf, for I cannot. Would you go in my stead?

'In the east are the ruins called Garth Agarwen. I would search there for Ivar the Blood-hand. If you find him and defeat him, bring his helm to me as proof.'
'You have done well in defeating Ivar the Bloodhand!'

'What is this, [placeholder]? The helm of Ivar the Blood-hand? Long has my order awaited this day.

'In ages past, Morgoth twisted enslaved Men and instilled them with fell spirits. These became the gaunt-men, but among them he selected five who would bear unimaginable power in mockery of the Wizards.

'Ivar was, in fact, made in mockery of me, and his death serves as justice for my kind. You have well earned this reward, [placeholder].'
'It is rumoured that the gaunt-men are creatures of great power twisted by Morgoth in the First Age...you were fortunate to survive against Ivar.'
'If the rumours are true, it may mean that Angmar is preparing to move upon Eriador. You must hurry.'

'What is this, [placeholder]? The helm of Ivar the Bloodhand? I am impressed, my friend. I did not think it possible. Here is a reward for your efforts.

'Go in safety.'

THIS NEEDS TO BE LOREIFIED RUDDER
Deliver Ivar's Helm to Radagast at the Eglan-camp
'If the rumours are true, it may mean that Angmar is preparing to move upon Eriador. You must hurry.'
